def _get_grouper(
    obj,
    key=None,
    axis=0,
    level=None,
    sort=True,
    observed=False,
    mutated=False,
    validate=True,
):
    # ... (existing implementation)

    # new handling for column names when 'key' is a list
    if isinstance(key, list):
        keys = key
        match_axis_length = len(keys) == len(group_axis)

        if match_axis_length and level is None:
            if isinstance(obj, DataFrame):
                all_in_columns_index = all(
                    g in obj.columns for g in keys
                )
            else:
                all_in_columns_index = all(g in obj.index.names for g in keys)

            if all_in_columns_index:
                # create a list of groupings for each column name in keys
                groupings = [
                    Grouping(
                        group_axis,
                        obj[g],
                        obj=obj,
                        name=g,
                        level=level,
                        sort=sort,
                        observed=observed,
                        in_axis=True,
                    )
                    for g in keys
                ]
                grouper = BaseGrouper(
                    group_axis, groupings, sort=sort, mutated=mutated
                )
                return grouper, [], obj
